column4: omg this is the second time this has happened to me ... i did a net install of the dapper i386 iso and for the second time, AFTER downloading and installation the screen HANGS. it's a black screen with what looks like to be two small white blocks on either side of the screen against a black background
and what's worse is that it leaves 0 partitions active after it!! now i'm in knoppix and i used qtparted to set hda2 back to active
does anyone know how to resolve this problem?
that's exactly what it looks like! seriously, without the ball of course
you remember the ping pong game on those old consoles? atari i think?

ok no one knows, i'll try a different problem then that's been bothering me... 2) i downloaded the dapper i386 iso, and i burnt it and boot it up with the "start and install" but it takes FOREVER to load (this is a 2.8ghz pc so..). What's worse is that it takes 3 minutes and 42 seconds (i timed it) to open up the installer in ubuntu! and it's even SLOWER to install it (i have yet to get past the "select timezone" part)
why does it take forever to open up the dapper live cd and install? i can't even get past the installation part because it's SOO SLOW and it's not my processor
I had a similiar issue, but I found that burning a more up to date iso helped things :)
really? i have the desktop dapper 6.06 iso, is there a newer one than that?
patches get release etc. I *think* they include patches in the isos, but I'm not sure.  I know that re-burning helped though
so reburn the patches to a new cd with the new iso?
alright i will, but SUPPOSE that doesn't work, what do i do? :)
so new cd, just a regular 6.06 dapper build right? not a nightly one or something?
yeah just download the iso from the servers
ok one Last question LOL :) which one do you have? the desktop version or hte server?
